courses.name: Introduction to Health: Determinants of Health & Health Care

cmCourseInfo.description: A multidisciplinary approach to understanding perspectives in health, health equity, and primary health care. Themes include critical discussion of the measurements of health outcomes and the socioeconomic and political factors that affect health, including neglected and marginalized populations in Canada and globally.
cmCourseInfo.title: Introduction to Health: Determinants of Health & Health Care

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Delivery Instructions

This is an online synchronous course. Lectures and class meetings will be live-streamed to enable real-time contact with the professor and classmates. Some course content will be available asynchronously which registered students can access on their own time. Students will have the opportunity for weekly online office hours to ask questions and clarifications about course content and assignments.

courses.name: Introduction to Research Methods in Health Studies

cmCourseInfo.description: Offers students in Health Studies a basic understanding of the logic of research methods, including research design and data collection on health topics as well as means for assessing validity, generalizability, and representativeness of data.
cmCourseInfo.title: Introduction to Research Methods in Health Studies

courses.name: Special Topics in Advanced Health Studies I

sections.name: LEC0101
sections.subTitle: Public Health Policy Engagement and Action

cmCourseInfo.description: The specific content of this course will vary from one year to another, depending on the availability of particular health researchers and scholars. Specific course information will be available on the Health Studies website at www.uc.utoronto.ca/healthstudies/.
cmCourseInfo.title: Special Topics in Advanced Health Studies I

cmCourseInfo.description: This two-semester course designation will permit students to gain academic credit for health studies pursued independently, or to participate in an ongoing health research project, under the supervision of a University of Toronto faculty member. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
cmCourseInfo.title: Independent Research in Health Studies
